module Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object in an UpdateWebACL request specifies
--   a <tt>Rule</tt> that you want to insert or delete, the priority of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt> in the <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS
--   WAF to take when a web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt>
--   (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
--   
--   To specify whether to insert or delete a <tt>Rule</tt>, use the
--   <tt>Action</tt> parameter in the WebACLUpdate data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivatedRule</a> smart constructor.
data ActivatedRule
ActivatedRule' :: Maybe WafOverrideAction -> Maybe WafAction -> Maybe [ExcludedRule] -> Maybe WafRuleType -> Int -> Text -> ActivatedRule

-- | Use the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to test your <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Any rule in a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> can potentially block a request. If
--   you set the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to <tt>None</tt>, the
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> will block a request if any individual rule in the
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> matches the request and is configured to block that
--   request. However if you first want to test the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>, set
--   the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to <tt>Count</tt>. The <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   will then override any block action specified by individual rules
--   contained within the group. Instead of blocking matching requests,
--   those requests will be counted. You can view a record of counted
--   requests using GetSampledRequests.
--   
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt> applies only when updating or
--   adding a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> to a <tt>WebACL</tt>. In this case you do
--   not use <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt>. For all other update requests,
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt> is used instead of
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt>.
[$sel:overrideAction:ActivatedRule'] :: ActivatedRule -> Maybe WafOverrideAction

-- | Specifies the action that CloudFront or AWS WAF takes when a web
--   request matches the conditions in the <tt>Rule</tt>. Valid values for
--   <tt>Action</tt> include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW</tt>: CloudFront responds with the requested
--   object.</li>
--   <li><tt>BLOCK</tt>: CloudFront responds with an HTTP 403 (Forbidden)
--   status code.</li>
--   <li><tt>COUNT</tt>: AWS WAF increments a counter of requests that
--   match the conditions in the rule and then continues to inspect the web
--   request based on the remaining rules in the web ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt> applies only when updating or
--   adding a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> to a <tt>WebACL</tt>. In this case, you do
--   not use <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt>. For all other update requests,
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt> is used instead of
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt>.
[$sel:action:ActivatedRule'] :: ActivatedRule -> Maybe WafAction

-- | An array of rules to exclude from a rule group. This is applicable
--   only when the <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> refers to a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Sometimes it is necessary to troubleshoot rule groups that are
--   blocking traffic unexpectedly (false positives). One troubleshooting
--   technique is to identify the specific rule within the rule group that
--   is blocking the legitimate traffic and then disable (exclude) that
--   particular rule. You can exclude rules from both your own rule groups
--   and AWS Marketplace rule groups that have been associated with a web
--   ACL.
--   
--   Specifying <tt>ExcludedRules</tt> does not remove those rules from the
--   rule group. Rather, it changes the action for the rules to
--   <tt>COUNT</tt>. Therefore, requests that match an
--   <tt>ExcludedRule</tt> are counted but not blocked. The
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> owner will receive COUNT metrics for each
--   <tt>ExcludedRule</tt>.
--   
--   If you want to exclude rules from a rule group that is already
--   associated with a web ACL, perform the following steps:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Use the AWS WAF logs to identify the IDs of the rules that you
--   want to exclude. For more information about the logs, see <a>Logging
--   Web ACL Traffic Information</a>.</li>
--   <li>Submit an UpdateWebACL request that has two actions:<ul><li>The
--   first action deletes the existing rule group from the web ACL. That
--   is, in the UpdateWebACL request, the first <tt>Updates:Action</tt>
--   should be <tt>DELETE</tt> and <tt>Updates:ActivatedRule:RuleId</tt>
--   should be the rule group that contains the rules that you want to
--   exclude.</li><li>The second action inserts the same rule group back
--   in, but specifying the rules to exclude. That is, the second
--   <tt>Updates:Action</tt> should be <tt>INSERT</tt>,
--   <tt>Updates:ActivatedRule:RuleId</tt> should be the rule group that
--   you just removed, and <tt>ExcludedRules</tt> should contain the rules
--   that you want to exclude.</li></ul></li>
--   </ol>
[$sel:excludedRules:ActivatedRule'] :: ActivatedRule -> Maybe [ExcludedRule]

-- | The rule type, either <tt>REGULAR</tt>, as defined by Rule,
--   <tt>RATE_BASED</tt>, as defined by RateBasedRule, or <tt>GROUP</tt>,
--   as defined by RuleGroup. The default is REGULAR. Although this field
--   is optional, be aware that if you try to add a RATE_BASED rule to a
--   web ACL without setting the type, the UpdateWebACL request will fail
--   because the request tries to add a REGULAR rule with the specified ID,
--   which does not exist.
[$sel:type':ActivatedRule'] :: ActivatedRule -> Maybe WafRuleType

-- | Specifies the order in which the <tt>Rules</tt> in a <tt>WebACL</tt>
--   are evaluated. Rules with a lower value for <tt>Priority</tt> are
--   evaluated before <tt>Rules</tt> with a higher value. The value must be
--   a unique integer. If you add multiple <tt>Rules</tt> to a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, the values don't need to be consecutive.
[$sel:priority:ActivatedRule'] :: ActivatedRule -> Int

-- | The <tt>RuleId</tt> for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to
--   get more information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
[$sel:ruleId:ActivatedRule'] :: ActivatedRule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivatedRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideAction:ActivatedRule'</a>,
--   <a>activatedRule_overrideAction</a> - Use the <tt>OverrideAction</tt>
--   to test your <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Any rule in a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> can potentially block a request. If
--   you set the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to <tt>None</tt>, the
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> will block a request if any individual rule in the
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> matches the request and is configured to block that
--   request. However if you first want to test the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>, set
--   the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to <tt>Count</tt>. The <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   will then override any block action specified by individual rules
--   contained within the group. Instead of blocking matching requests,
--   those requests will be counted. You can view a record of counted
--   requests using GetSampledRequests.
--   
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt> applies only when updating or
--   adding a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> to a <tt>WebACL</tt>. In this case you do
--   not use <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt>. For all other update requests,
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt> is used instead of
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:ActivatedRule'</a>, <a>activatedRule_action</a> -
--   Specifies the action that CloudFront or AWS WAF takes when a web
--   request matches the conditions in the <tt>Rule</tt>. Valid values for
--   <tt>Action</tt> include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW</tt>: CloudFront responds with the requested
--   object.</li>
--   <li><tt>BLOCK</tt>: CloudFront responds with an HTTP 403 (Forbidden)
--   status code.</li>
--   <li><tt>COUNT</tt>: AWS WAF increments a counter of requests that
--   match the conditions in the rule and then continues to inspect the web
--   request based on the remaining rules in the web ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt> applies only when updating or
--   adding a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> to a <tt>WebACL</tt>. In this case, you do
--   not use <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt>. For all other update requests,
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt> is used instead of
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludedRules:ActivatedRule'</a>,
--   <a>activatedRule_excludedRules</a> - An array of rules to exclude from
--   a rule group. This is applicable only when the <tt>ActivatedRule</tt>
--   refers to a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Sometimes it is necessary to troubleshoot rule groups that are
--   blocking traffic unexpectedly (false positives). One troubleshooting
--   technique is to identify the specific rule within the rule group that
--   is blocking the legitimate traffic and then disable (exclude) that
--   particular rule. You can exclude rules from both your own rule groups
--   and AWS Marketplace rule groups that have been associated with a web
--   ACL.
--   
--   Specifying <tt>ExcludedRules</tt> does not remove those rules from the
--   rule group. Rather, it changes the action for the rules to
--   <tt>COUNT</tt>. Therefore, requests that match an
--   <tt>ExcludedRule</tt> are counted but not blocked. The
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> owner will receive COUNT metrics for each
--   <tt>ExcludedRule</tt>.
--   
--   If you want to exclude rules from a rule group that is already
--   associated with a web ACL, perform the following steps:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Use the AWS WAF logs to identify the IDs of the rules that you
--   want to exclude. For more information about the logs, see <a>Logging
--   Web ACL Traffic Information</a>.</li>
--   <li>Submit an UpdateWebACL request that has two actions:<ul><li>The
--   first action deletes the existing rule group from the web ACL. That
--   is, in the UpdateWebACL request, the first <tt>Updates:Action</tt>
--   should be <tt>DELETE</tt> and <tt>Updates:ActivatedRule:RuleId</tt>
--   should be the rule group that contains the rules that you want to
--   exclude.</li><li>The second action inserts the same rule group back
--   in, but specifying the rules to exclude. That is, the second
--   <tt>Updates:Action</tt> should be <tt>INSERT</tt>,
--   <tt>Updates:ActivatedRule:RuleId</tt> should be the rule group that
--   you just removed, and <tt>ExcludedRules</tt> should contain the rules
--   that you want to exclude.</li></ul></li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ActivatedRule'</a>, <a>activatedRule_type</a> - The rule
--   type, either <tt>REGULAR</tt>, as defined by Rule,
--   <tt>RATE_BASED</tt>, as defined by RateBasedRule, or <tt>GROUP</tt>,
--   as defined by RuleGroup. The default is REGULAR. Although this field
--   is optional, be aware that if you try to add a RATE_BASED rule to a
--   web ACL without setting the type, the UpdateWebACL request will fail
--   because the request tries to add a REGULAR rule with the specified ID,
--   which does not exist.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:ActivatedRule'</a>, <a>activatedRule_priority</a> -
--   Specifies the order in which the <tt>Rules</tt> in a <tt>WebACL</tt>
--   are evaluated. Rules with a lower value for <tt>Priority</tt> are
--   evaluated before <tt>Rules</tt> with a higher value. The value must be
--   a unique integer. If you add multiple <tt>Rules</tt> to a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, the values don't need to be consecutive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleId:ActivatedRule'</a>, <a>activatedRule_ruleId</a> - The
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to get
--   more information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
newActivatedRule :: Int -> Text -> ActivatedRule

-- | Use the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to test your <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Any rule in a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> can potentially block a request. If
--   you set the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to <tt>None</tt>, the
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> will block a request if any individual rule in the
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> matches the request and is configured to block that
--   request. However if you first want to test the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>, set
--   the <tt>OverrideAction</tt> to <tt>Count</tt>. The <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   will then override any block action specified by individual rules
--   contained within the group. Instead of blocking matching requests,
--   those requests will be counted. You can view a record of counted
--   requests using GetSampledRequests.
--   
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt> applies only when updating or
--   adding a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> to a <tt>WebACL</tt>. In this case you do
--   not use <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt>. For all other update requests,
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt> is used instead of
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt>.
activatedRule_overrideAction :: Lens' ActivatedRule (Maybe WafOverrideAction)

-- | Specifies the action that CloudFront or AWS WAF takes when a web
--   request matches the conditions in the <tt>Rule</tt>. Valid values for
--   <tt>Action</tt> include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW</tt>: CloudFront responds with the requested
--   object.</li>
--   <li><tt>BLOCK</tt>: CloudFront responds with an HTTP 403 (Forbidden)
--   status code.</li>
--   <li><tt>COUNT</tt>: AWS WAF increments a counter of requests that
--   match the conditions in the rule and then continues to inspect the web
--   request based on the remaining rules in the web ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt> applies only when updating or
--   adding a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> to a <tt>WebACL</tt>. In this case, you do
--   not use <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt>. For all other update requests,
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|Action</tt> is used instead of
--   <tt>ActivatedRule|OverrideAction</tt>.
activatedRule_action :: Lens' ActivatedRule (Maybe WafAction)

-- | An array of rules to exclude from a rule group. This is applicable
--   only when the <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> refers to a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   Sometimes it is necessary to troubleshoot rule groups that are
--   blocking traffic unexpectedly (false positives). One troubleshooting
--   technique is to identify the specific rule within the rule group that
--   is blocking the legitimate traffic and then disable (exclude) that
--   particular rule. You can exclude rules from both your own rule groups
--   and AWS Marketplace rule groups that have been associated with a web
--   ACL.
--   
--   Specifying <tt>ExcludedRules</tt> does not remove those rules from the
--   rule group. Rather, it changes the action for the rules to
--   <tt>COUNT</tt>. Therefore, requests that match an
--   <tt>ExcludedRule</tt> are counted but not blocked. The
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> owner will receive COUNT metrics for each
--   <tt>ExcludedRule</tt>.
--   
--   If you want to exclude rules from a rule group that is already
--   associated with a web ACL, perform the following steps:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Use the AWS WAF logs to identify the IDs of the rules that you
--   want to exclude. For more information about the logs, see <a>Logging
--   Web ACL Traffic Information</a>.</li>
--   <li>Submit an UpdateWebACL request that has two actions:<ul><li>The
--   first action deletes the existing rule group from the web ACL. That
--   is, in the UpdateWebACL request, the first <tt>Updates:Action</tt>
--   should be <tt>DELETE</tt> and <tt>Updates:ActivatedRule:RuleId</tt>
--   should be the rule group that contains the rules that you want to
--   exclude.</li><li>The second action inserts the same rule group back
--   in, but specifying the rules to exclude. That is, the second
--   <tt>Updates:Action</tt> should be <tt>INSERT</tt>,
--   <tt>Updates:ActivatedRule:RuleId</tt> should be the rule group that
--   you just removed, and <tt>ExcludedRules</tt> should contain the rules
--   that you want to exclude.</li></ul></li>
--   </ol>
activatedRule_excludedRules :: Lens' ActivatedRule (Maybe [ExcludedRule])

-- | The rule type, either <tt>REGULAR</tt>, as defined by Rule,
--   <tt>RATE_BASED</tt>, as defined by RateBasedRule, or <tt>GROUP</tt>,
--   as defined by RuleGroup. The default is REGULAR. Although this field
--   is optional, be aware that if you try to add a RATE_BASED rule to a
--   web ACL without setting the type, the UpdateWebACL request will fail
--   because the request tries to add a REGULAR rule with the specified ID,
--   which does not exist.
activatedRule_type :: Lens' ActivatedRule (Maybe WafRuleType)

-- | Specifies the order in which the <tt>Rules</tt> in a <tt>WebACL</tt>
--   are evaluated. Rules with a lower value for <tt>Priority</tt> are
--   evaluated before <tt>Rules</tt> with a higher value. The value must be
--   a unique integer. If you add multiple <tt>Rules</tt> to a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, the values don't need to be consecutive.
activatedRule_priority :: Lens' ActivatedRule Int

-- | The <tt>RuleId</tt> for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to
--   get more information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
activatedRule_ruleId :: Lens' ActivatedRule Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.WAF.Types.ActivatedRule.ActivatedRule


module Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> and indicates whether you want to
--   add it to a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> or delete it from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRuleGroupUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data RuleGroupUpdate
RuleGroupUpdate' :: ChangeAction -> ActivatedRule -> RuleGroupUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> to a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an
--   <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
[$sel:action:RuleGroupUpdate'] :: RuleGroupUpdate -> ChangeAction

-- | The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object specifies a <tt>Rule</tt> that you
--   want to insert or delete, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt> in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS WAF to take when a
--   web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt> (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>,
--   or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
[$sel:activatedRule:RuleGroupUpdate'] :: RuleGroupUpdate -> ActivatedRule

-- | Create a value of <a>RuleGroupUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:RuleGroupUpdate'</a>, <a>ruleGroupUpdate_action</a> -
--   Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> to a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an
--   <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activatedRule:RuleGroupUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>ruleGroupUpdate_activatedRule</a> - The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt>
--   object specifies a <tt>Rule</tt> that you want to insert or delete,
--   the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt> in the <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the
--   action that you want AWS WAF to take when a web request matches the
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
newRuleGroupUpdate :: ChangeAction -> ActivatedRule -> RuleGroupUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> to a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an
--   <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
ruleGroupUpdate_action :: Lens' RuleGroupUpdate ChangeAction

-- | The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object specifies a <tt>Rule</tt> that you
--   want to insert or delete, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt> in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS WAF to take when a
--   web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt> (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>,
--   or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
ruleGroupUpdate_activatedRule :: Lens' RuleGroupUpdate ActivatedRule
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate.RuleGroupUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate.RuleGroupUpdate
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate.RuleGroupUpdate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate.RuleGroupUpdate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate.RuleGroupUpdate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate.RuleGroupUpdate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.WAF.Types.RuleGroupUpdate.RuleGroupUpdate


module Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Contains the <tt>Rules</tt> that identify the requests that you want
--   to allow, block, or count. In a <tt>WebACL</tt>, you also specify a
--   default action (<tt>ALLOW</tt> or <tt>BLOCK</tt>), and the action for
--   each <tt>Rule</tt> that you add to a <tt>WebACL</tt>, for example,
--   block requests from specified IP addresses or block requests from
--   specified referrers. You also associate the <tt>WebACL</tt> with a
--   CloudFront distribution to identify the requests that you want AWS WAF
--   to filter. If you add more than one <tt>Rule</tt> to a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, a request needs to match only one of the
--   specifications to be allowed, blocked, or counted. For more
--   information, see UpdateWebACL.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebACL</a> smart constructor.
data WebACL
WebACL' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> WafAction -> [ActivatedRule] -> WebACL

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change
--   <tt>MetricName</tt> after you create the <tt>WebACL</tt>.
[$sel:metricName:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Maybe Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the <tt>WebACL</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Maybe Text

-- | Tha Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the web ACL.
[$sel:webACLArn:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
[$sel:webACLId:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Text

-- | The action to perform if none of the <tt>Rules</tt> contained in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> match. The action is specified by the WafAction
--   object.
[$sel:defaultAction:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> WafAction

-- | An array that contains the action for each <tt>Rule</tt> in a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt>, and the ID of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt>.
[$sel:rules:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> [ActivatedRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>WebACL</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_metricName</a> - A friendly
--   name or description for the metrics for this <tt>WebACL</tt>. The name
--   can contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum
--   length 128 and minimum length one. It can't contain whitespace or
--   metric names reserved for AWS WAF, including "All" and
--   "Default_Action." You can't change <tt>MetricName</tt> after you
--   create the <tt>WebACL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_name</a> - A friendly name or
--   description of the <tt>WebACL</tt>. You can't change the name of a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:webACLArn:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_webACLArn</a> - Tha Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the web ACL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:webACLId:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_webACLId</a> - A unique
--   identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt> to get
--   information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAction:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_defaultAction</a> - The
--   action to perform if none of the <tt>Rules</tt> contained in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> match. The action is specified by the WafAction
--   object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_rules</a> - An array that
--   contains the action for each <tt>Rule</tt> in a <tt>WebACL</tt>, the
--   priority of the <tt>Rule</tt>, and the ID of the <tt>Rule</tt>.
newWebACL :: Text -> WafAction -> WebACL

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change
--   <tt>MetricName</tt> after you create the <tt>WebACL</tt>.
webACL_metricName :: Lens' WebACL (Maybe Text)

-- | A friendly name or description of the <tt>WebACL</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
webACL_name :: Lens' WebACL (Maybe Text)

-- | Tha Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the web ACL.
webACL_webACLArn :: Lens' WebACL (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
webACL_webACLId :: Lens' WebACL Text

-- | The action to perform if none of the <tt>Rules</tt> contained in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> match. The action is specified by the WafAction
--   object.
webACL_defaultAction :: Lens' WebACL WafAction

-- | An array that contains the action for each <tt>Rule</tt> in a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt>, and the ID of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt>.
webACL_rules :: Lens' WebACL [ActivatedRule]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL.WebACL
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL.WebACL
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL.WebACL
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL.WebACL
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL.WebACL
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL.WebACL
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACL.WebACL


module Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLSummary

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Contains the identifier and the name or description of the WebACL.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebACLSummary</a> smart constructor.
data WebACLSummary
WebACLSummary' :: Text -> Text -> WebACLSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
[$sel:webACLId:WebACLSummary'] :: WebACLSummary -> Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the WebACL. You can't change the
--   name of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:WebACLSummary'] :: WebACLSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WebACLSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:webACLId:WebACLSummary'</a>, <a>webACLSummary_webACLId</a> - A
--   unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt> to
--   get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WebACLSummary'</a>, <a>webACLSummary_name</a> - A
--   friendly name or description of the WebACL. You can't change the name
--   of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
newWebACLSummary :: Text -> Text -> WebACLSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
webACLSummary_webACLId :: Lens' WebACLSummary Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the WebACL. You can't change the
--   name of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
webACLSummary_name :: Lens' WebACLSummary Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLSummary.WebACLSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLSummary.WebACLSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLSummary.WebACLSummary

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLSummary.WebACLSummary


module Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLUpdate

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies whether to insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into or delete a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> from a <tt>WebACL</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebACLUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data WebACLUpdate
WebACLUpdate' :: ChangeAction -> ActivatedRule -> WebACLUpdate

-- | Specifies whether to insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into or delete a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> from a <tt>WebACL</tt>.
[$sel:action:WebACLUpdate'] :: WebACLUpdate -> ChangeAction

-- | The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object in an UpdateWebACL request specifies
--   a <tt>Rule</tt> that you want to insert or delete, the priority of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt> in the <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS
--   WAF to take when a web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt>
--   (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
[$sel:activatedRule:WebACLUpdate'] :: WebACLUpdate -> ActivatedRule

-- | Create a value of <a>WebACLUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:WebACLUpdate'</a>, <a>webACLUpdate_action</a> -
--   Specifies whether to insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into or delete a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> from a <tt>WebACL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activatedRule:WebACLUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>webACLUpdate_activatedRule</a> - The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object
--   in an UpdateWebACL request specifies a <tt>Rule</tt> that you want to
--   insert or delete, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt> in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS WAF to take when a
--   web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt> (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>,
--   or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
newWebACLUpdate :: ChangeAction -> ActivatedRule -> WebACLUpdate

-- | Specifies whether to insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into or delete a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> from a <tt>WebACL</tt>.
webACLUpdate_action :: Lens' WebACLUpdate ChangeAction

-- | The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object in an UpdateWebACL request specifies
--   a <tt>Rule</tt> that you want to insert or delete, the priority of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt> in the <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS
--   WAF to take when a web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt>
--   (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
webACLUpdate_activatedRule :: Lens' WebACLUpdate ActivatedRule
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLUpdate.WebACLUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLUpdate.WebACLUpdate
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLUpdate.WebACLUpdate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.WAF.Types.WebACLUpdate.WebACLUpdate

module Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetSummary

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   The <tt>Id</tt> and <tt>Name</tt> of an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newXssMatchSetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data XssMatchSetSummary
XssMatchSetSummary' :: Text -> Text -> XssMatchSetSummary

-- | A unique identifier for an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> to get information about a <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>
--   (see GetXssMatchSet), update an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see
--   UpdateXssMatchSet), insert an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> into a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one from a <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and
--   delete an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> from AWS WAF (see DeleteXssMatchSet).
--   
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> is returned by CreateXssMatchSet and by
--   ListXssMatchSets.
[$sel:xssMatchSetId:XssMatchSetSummary'] :: XssMatchSetSummary -> Text

-- | The name of the <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>, if any, specified by
--   <tt>Id</tt>.
[$sel:name:XssMatchSetSummary'] :: XssMatchSetSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>XssMatchSetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>. You use <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> to get
--   information about a <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see GetXssMatchSet), update
--   an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see UpdateXssMatchSet), insert an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> into a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one from a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and delete an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>
--   from AWS WAF (see DeleteXssMatchSet).
--   
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> is returned by CreateXssMatchSet and by
--   ListXssMatchSets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:XssMatchSetSummary'</a>, <a>xssMatchSetSummary_name</a> -
--   The name of the <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>, if any, specified by
--   <tt>Id</tt>.
newXssMatchSetSummary :: Text -> Text -> XssMatchSetSummary

-- | A unique identifier for an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> to get information about a <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>
--   (see GetXssMatchSet), update an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see
--   UpdateXssMatchSet), insert an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> into a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one from a <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and

module Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchTuple

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies the part of a web request that you want AWS WAF to inspect
--   for cross-site scripting attacks and, if you want AWS WAF to inspect a
--   header, the name of the header.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newXssMatchTuple</a> smart constructor.
data XssMatchTuple
XssMatchTuple' :: FieldToMatch -> TextTransformation -> XssMatchTuple

-- | Specifies where in a web request to look for cross-site scripting
--   attacks.
[$sel:fieldToMatch:XssMatchTuple'] :: XssMatchTuple -> FieldToMatch

-- | Text transformations eliminate some of the unusual formatting that
--   attackers use in web requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you
--   specify a transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.
--   
--   <b>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace HTML-encoded characters with unencoded
--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>LOWERCASE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
[$sel:textTransformation:XssMatchTuple'] :: XssMatchTuple -> TextTransformation

-- | Create a value of <a>XssMatchTuple</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldToMatch:XssMatchTuple'</a>,
--   <a>xssMatchTuple_fieldToMatch</a> - Specifies where in a web request
--   to look for cross-site scripting attacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textTransformation:XssMatchTuple'</a>,
--   <a>xssMatchTuple_textTransformation</a> - Text transformations
--   eliminate some of the unusual formatting that attackers use in web
--   requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you specify a
--   transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.
--   
--   <b>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace HTML-encoded characters with unencoded
--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>LOWERCASE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
newXssMatchTuple :: FieldToMatch -> TextTransformation -> XssMatchTuple

-- | Specifies where in a web request to look for cross-site scripting
--   attacks.
xssMatchTuple_fieldToMatch :: Lens' XssMatchTuple FieldToMatch

-- | Text transformations eliminate some of the unusual formatting that
--   attackers use in web requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you
--   specify a transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.
--   
--   <b>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace HTML-encoded characters with unencoded
--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>LOWERCASE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
xssMatchTuple_textTransformation :: Lens' XssMatchTuple TextTransformation
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchTuple.XssMatchTuple
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchTuple.XssMatchTuple
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchTuple.XssMatchTuple
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchTuple.XssMatchTuple
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchTuple.XssMatchTuple

module Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies the part of a web request that you want to inspect for
--   cross-site scripting attacks and indicates whether you want to add the
--   specification to an XssMatchSet or delete it from an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newXssMatchSetUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data XssMatchSetUpdate
XssMatchSetUpdate' :: ChangeAction -> XssMatchTuple -> XssMatchSetUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an XssMatchSetUpdate to an XssMatchSet.
--   Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an <tt>XssMatchSetUpdate</tt> from an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
[$sel:action:XssMatchSetUpdate'] :: XssMatchSetUpdate -> ChangeAction

-- | Specifies the part of a web request that you want AWS WAF to inspect
--   for cross-site scripting attacks and, if you want AWS WAF to inspect a
--   header, the name of the header.
[$sel:xssMatchTuple:XssMatchSetUpdate'] :: XssMatchSetUpdate -> XssMatchTuple

-- | Create a value of <a>XssMatchSetUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:XssMatchSetUpdate'</a>, <a>xssMatchSetUpdate_action</a>
--   - Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an XssMatchSetUpdate to an
--   XssMatchSet. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an
--   <tt>XssMatchSetUpdate</tt> from an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xssMatchTuple:XssMatchSetUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>xssMatchSetUpdate_xssMatchTuple</a> - Specifies the part of a web
--   request that you want AWS WAF to inspect for cross-site scripting
--   attacks and, if you want AWS WAF to inspect a header, the name of the
--   header.
newXssMatchSetUpdate :: ChangeAction -> XssMatchTuple -> XssMatchSetUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an XssMatchSetUpdate to an XssMatchSet.
--   Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an <tt>XssMatchSetUpdate</tt> from an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
xssMatchSetUpdate_action :: Lens' XssMatchSetUpdate ChangeAction

-- | Specifies the part of a web request that you want AWS WAF to inspect
--   for cross-site scripting attacks and, if you want AWS WAF to inspect a
--   header, the name of the header.
xssMatchSetUpdate_xssMatchTuple :: Lens' XssMatchSetUpdate XssMatchTuple
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate.XssMatchSetUpdate
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate.XssMatchSetUpdate
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate.XssMatchSetUpdate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate.XssMatchSetUpdate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate.XssMatchSetUpdate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate.XssMatchSetUpdate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSetUpdate.XssMatchSetUpdate


module Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   A complex type that contains <tt>XssMatchTuple</tt> objects, which
--   specify the parts of web requests that you want AWS WAF to inspect for
--   cross-site scripting attacks and, if you want AWS WAF to inspect a
--   header, the name of the header. If a <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> contains
--   more than one <tt>XssMatchTuple</tt> object, a request needs to
--   include cross-site scripting attacks in only one of the specified
--   parts of the request to be considered a match.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newXssMatchSet</a> smart constructor.
data XssMatchSet
XssMatchSet' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> [XssMatchTuple] -> XssMatchSet

-- | The name, if any, of the <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
[$sel:name:XssMatchSet'] :: XssMatchSet -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> to get information about an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see GetXssMatchSet), update an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see UpdateXssMatchSet), insert an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> into a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one from a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and delete an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>
--   from AWS WAF (see DeleteXssMatchSet).
--   
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> is returned by CreateXssMatchSet and by
--   ListXssMatchSets.
[$sel:xssMatchSetId:XssMatchSet'] :: XssMatchSet -> Text

-- | Specifies the parts of web requests that you want to inspect for
--   cross-site scripting attacks.
[$sel:xssMatchTuples:XssMatchSet'] :: XssMatchSet -> [XssMatchTuple]

-- | Create a value of <a>XssMatchSet</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:XssMatchSet'</a>, <a>xssMatchSet_name</a> - The name, if
--   any, of the <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xssMatchSetId:XssMatchSet'</a>,
--   <a>xssMatchSet_xssMatchSetId</a> - A unique identifier for an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>. You use <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> to get
--   information about an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see GetXssMatchSet), update
--   an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see UpdateXssMatchSet), insert an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> into a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one from a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and delete an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>
--   from AWS WAF (see DeleteXssMatchSet).
--   
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> is returned by CreateXssMatchSet and by
--   ListXssMatchSets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:xssMatchTuples:XssMatchSet'</a>,
--   <a>xssMatchSet_xssMatchTuples</a> - Specifies the parts of web
--   requests that you want to inspect for cross-site scripting attacks.
newXssMatchSet :: Text -> XssMatchSet

-- | The name, if any, of the <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>.
xssMatchSet_name :: Lens' XssMatchSet (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> to get information about an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see GetXssMatchSet), update an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> (see UpdateXssMatchSet), insert an
--   <tt>XssMatchSet</tt> into a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one from a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and delete an <tt>XssMatchSet</tt>
--   from AWS WAF (see DeleteXssMatchSet).
--   
--   <tt>XssMatchSetId</tt> is returned by CreateXssMatchSet and by
--   ListXssMatchSets.
xssMatchSet_xssMatchSetId :: Lens' XssMatchSet Text

-- | Specifies the parts of web requests that you want to inspect for
--   cross-site scripting attacks.
xssMatchSet_xssMatchTuples :: Lens' XssMatchSet [XssMatchTuple]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet.XssMatchSet
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet.XssMatchSet
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet.XssMatchSet
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet.XssMatchSet
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet.XssMatchSet
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet.XssMatchSet
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.WAF.Types.XssMatchSet.XssMatchSet


module Amazonka.WAF.Types

-- | API version <tt>2015-08-24</tt> of the Amazon WAF SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The operation failed because you tried to create, update, or delete an
--   object by using an invalid account identifier.
_WAFInvalidAccountException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified subscription does not exist.
_WAFSubscriptionNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because you tried to delete an object that is
--   still in use. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You tried to delete a <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> that is still
--   referenced by a <tt>Rule</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to delete a <tt>Rule</tt> that is still referenced by a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
_WAFReferencedItemException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

_WAFTagOperationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed due to a problem with the migration. The failure
--   cause is provided in the exception, in the
--   <tt>MigrationErrorType</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ENTITY_NOT_SUPPORTED</tt> - The web ACL has an unsupported
--   entity but the <tt>IgnoreUnsupportedType</tt> is not set to true.</li>
--   <li><tt>ENTITY_NOT_FOUND</tt> - The web ACL doesn't exist.</li>
--   <li><tt>S3_BUCKET_NO_PERMISSION</tt> - You don't have permission to
--   perform the <tt>PutObject</tt> action to the specified Amazon S3
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li><tt>S3_BUCKET_NOT_ACCESSIBLE</tt> - The bucket policy doesn't
--   allow AWS WAF to perform the <tt>PutObject</tt> action in the
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li><tt>S3_BUCKET_NOT_FOUND</tt> - The S3 bucket doesn't exist.</li>
--   <li><tt>S3_BUCKET_INVALID_REGION</tt> - The S3 bucket is not in the
--   same Region as the web ACL.</li>
--   <li><tt>S3_INTERNAL_ERROR</tt> - AWS WAF failed to create the template
--   in the S3 bucket for another reason.</li>
--   </ul>
_WAFEntityMigrationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The regular expression (regex) you specified in
--   <tt>RegexPatternString</tt> is invalid.
_WAFInvalidRegexPatternException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because there was nothing to do. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You tried to remove a <tt>Rule</tt> from a <tt>WebACL</tt>, but
--   the <tt>Rule</tt> isn't in the specified <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to remove an IP address from an <tt>IPSet</tt>, but the
--   IP address isn't in the specified <tt>IPSet</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to remove a <tt>ByteMatchTuple</tt> from a
--   <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt>, but the <tt>ByteMatchTuple</tt> isn't in the
--   specified <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to add a <tt>Rule</tt> to a <tt>WebACL</tt>, but the
--   <tt>Rule</tt> already exists in the specified <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to add a <tt>ByteMatchTuple</tt> to a
--   <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt>, but the <tt>ByteMatchTuple</tt> already exists
--   in the specified <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
_WAFInvalidOperationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

_WAFBadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because the referenced object doesn't exist.
_WAFNonexistentItemException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because AWS WAF didn't recognize a parameter in
--   the request. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You specified an invalid parameter name.</li>
--   <li>You specified an invalid value.</li>
--   <li>You tried to update an object (<tt>ByteMatchSet</tt>,
--   <tt>IPSet</tt>, <tt>Rule</tt>, or <tt>WebACL</tt>) using an action
--   other than <tt>INSERT</tt> or <tt>DELETE</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to create a <tt>WebACL</tt> with a
--   <tt>DefaultAction</tt> <tt>Type</tt> other than <tt>ALLOW</tt>,
--   <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to create a <tt>RateBasedRule</tt> with a
--   <tt>RateKey</tt> value other than <tt>IP</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to update a <tt>WebACL</tt> with a <tt>WafAction</tt>
--   <tt>Type</tt> other than <tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or
--   <tt>COUNT</tt>.</li>
--   <li>You tried to update a <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> with a
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> <tt>Type</tt> other than HEADER, METHOD,
--   QUERY_STRING, URI, or BODY.</li>
--   <li>You tried to update a <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> with a <tt>Field</tt>
--   of <tt>HEADER</tt> but no value for <tt>Data</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Your request references an ARN that is malformed, or corresponds
--   to a resource with which a web ACL cannot be associated.</li>
--   </ul>
_WAFInvalidParameterException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

_WAFTagOperationInternalErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS WAF is not able to access the service linked role. This can be
--   caused by a previous <tt>PutLoggingConfiguration</tt> request, which
--   can lock the service linked role for about 20 seconds. Please try your
--   request again. The service linked role can also be locked by a
--   previous <tt>DeleteServiceLinkedRole</tt> request, which can lock the
--   role for 15 minutes or more. If you recently made a
--   <tt>DeleteServiceLinkedRole</tt>, wait at least 15 minutes and try the
--   request again. If you receive this same exception again, you will have
--   to wait additional time until the role is unlocked.
_WAFServiceLinkedRoleErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation exceeds a resource limit, for example, the maximum
--   number of <tt>WebACL</tt> objects that you can create for an AWS
--   account. For more information, see <a>Limits</a> in the <i>AWS WAF
--   Developer Guide</i>.
_WAFLimitsExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because the specified policy is not in the proper
--   format.
--   
--   The policy is subject to the following restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You can attach only one policy with each
--   <tt>PutPermissionPolicy</tt> request.</li>
--   <li>The policy must include an <tt>Effect</tt>, <tt>Action</tt> and
--   <tt>Principal</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Effect</tt> must specify <tt>Allow</tt>.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>Action</tt> in the policy must be
--   <tt>waf:UpdateWebACL</tt>, <tt>waf-regional:UpdateWebACL</tt>,
--   <tt>waf:GetRuleGroup</tt> and <tt>waf-regional:GetRuleGroup</tt> . Any
--   extra or wildcard actions in the policy will be rejected.</li>
--   <li>The policy cannot include a <tt>Resource</tt> parameter.</li>
--   <li>The ARN in the request must be a valid WAF RuleGroup ARN and the
--   RuleGroup must exist in the same region.</li>
--   <li>The user making the request must be the owner of the
--   RuleGroup.</li>
--   <li>Your policy must be composed using IAM Policy version
--   2012-10-17.</li>
--   </ul>
_WAFInvalidPermissionPolicyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because you tried to create, update, or delete an
--   object by using a change token that has already been used.
_WAFStaleDataException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because of a system problem, even though the
--   request was valid. Retry your request.
_WAFInternalErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because you tried to add an object to or delete
--   an object from another object that doesn't exist. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You tried to add a <tt>Rule</tt> to or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from
--   a <tt>WebACL</tt> that doesn't exist.</li>
--   <li>You tried to add a <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> to or delete a
--   <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> from a <tt>Rule</tt> that doesn't exist.</li>
--   <li>You tried to add an IP address to or delete an IP address from an
--   <tt>IPSet</tt> that doesn't exist.</li>
--   <li>You tried to add a <tt>ByteMatchTuple</tt> to or delete a
--   <tt>ByteMatchTuple</tt> from a <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> that doesn't
--   exist.</li>
--   </ul>
_WAFNonexistentContainerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The name specified is invalid.
_WAFDisallowedNameException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because you tried to delete an object that isn't
--   empty. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You tried to delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> that still contains one or
--   more <tt>Rule</tt> objects.</li>
--   <li>You tried to delete a <tt>Rule</tt> that still contains one or
--   more <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> objects or other predicates.</li>
--   <li>You tried to delete a <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> that contains one or
--   more <tt>ByteMatchTuple</tt> objects.</li>
--   <li>You tried to delete an <tt>IPSet</tt> that references one or more
--   IP addresses.</li>
--   </ul>
_WAFNonEmptyEntityException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TF :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TG :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TH :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TJ :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TK :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TL :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TM :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TN :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TO :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TR :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TT :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TV :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TW :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_TZ :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_UA :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_UG :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_UM :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_US :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_UY :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_UZ :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_VA :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_VC :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_VE :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_VG :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_VI :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_VN :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_VU :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_WF :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_WS :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_YE :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_YT :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_ZA :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_ZM :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
pattern GeoMatchConstraintValue_ZW :: GeoMatchConstraintValue
newtype IPSetDescriptorType
IPSetDescriptorType' :: Text -> IPSetDescriptorType
[fromIPSetDescriptorType] :: IPSetDescriptorType -> Text
pattern IPSetDescriptorType_IPV4 :: IPSetDescriptorType
pattern IPSetDescriptorType_IPV6 :: IPSetDescriptorType
newtype MatchFieldType
MatchFieldType' :: Text -> MatchFieldType
[fromMatchFieldType] :: MatchFieldType -> Text
pattern MatchFieldType_ALL_QUERY_ARGS :: MatchFieldType
pattern MatchFieldType_BODY :: MatchFieldType
pattern MatchFieldType_HEADER :: MatchFieldType
pattern MatchFieldType_METHOD :: MatchFieldType
pattern MatchFieldType_QUERY_STRING :: MatchFieldType
pattern MatchFieldType_SINGLE_QUERY_ARG :: MatchFieldType
pattern MatchFieldType_URI :: MatchFieldType
newtype PositionalConstraint
PositionalConstraint' :: Text -> PositionalConstraint

pattern PositionalConstraint_CONTAINS :: PositionalConstraint
pattern PositionalConstraint_CONTAINS_WORD :: PositionalConstraint
pattern PositionalConstraint_ENDS_WITH :: PositionalConstraint
pattern PositionalConstraint_EXACTLY :: PositionalConstraint
pattern PositionalConstraint_STARTS_WITH :: PositionalConstraint

pattern RateKey_IP :: RateKey
newtype TextTransformation
TextTransformation' :: Text -> TextTransformation
[fromTextTransformation] :: TextTransformation -> Text
