-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   A combination of ByteMatchSet, IPSet, and/or SqlInjectionMatchSet
--   objects that identify the web requests that you want to allow, block,
--   or count. For example, you might create a <tt>Rule</tt> that includes
--   the following predicates:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>An <tt>IPSet</tt> that causes AWS WAF to search for web requests
--   that originate from the IP address <tt>192.0.2.44</tt></li>
--   <li>A <tt>ByteMatchSet</tt> that causes AWS WAF to search for web
--   requests for which the value of the <tt>User-Agent</tt> header is
--   <tt>BadBot</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To match the settings in this <tt>Rule</tt>, a request must originate
--   from <tt>192.0.2.44</tt> AND include a <tt>User-Agent</tt> header for
--   which the value is <tt>BadBot</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRule</a> smart constructor.
data Rule
Rule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> [Predicate] -> Rule

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this <tt>Rule</tt>.
--   The name can contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9),
--   with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It can't contain
--   whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF, including "All" and
--   "Default_Action." You can't change <tt>MetricName</tt> after you
--   create the <tt>Rule</tt>.
[$sel:metricName:Rule'] :: Rule -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name or description for the <tt>Rule</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>Rule</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:Rule'] :: Rule -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to
--   get more information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
[$sel:ruleId:Rule'] :: Rule -> Text

-- | The <tt>Predicates</tt> object contains one <tt>Predicate</tt> element
--   for each ByteMatchSet, IPSet, or SqlInjectionMatchSet object that you
--   want to include in a <tt>Rule</tt>.
[$sel:predicates:Rule'] :: Rule -> [Predicate]

-- | Create a value of <a>Rule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_metricName</a> - A friendly name
--   or description for the metrics for this <tt>Rule</tt>. The name can
--   contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum
--   length 128 and minimum length one. It can't contain whitespace or
--   metric names reserved for AWS WAF, including "All" and
--   "Default_Action." You can't change <tt>MetricName</tt> after you
--   create the <tt>Rule</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_name</a> - The friendly name or
--   description for the <tt>Rule</tt>. You can't change the name of a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> after you create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleId:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_ruleId</a> - A unique identifier for
--   a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to get more information about
--   a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a <tt>Rule</tt> (see
--   UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a
--   one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), or delete a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
--   
--   <a>$sel:predicates:Rule'</a>, <a>rule_predicates</a> - The
--   <tt>Predicates</tt> object contains one <tt>Predicate</tt> element for
--   each ByteMatchSet, IPSet, or SqlInjectionMatchSet object that you want
--   to include in a <tt>Rule</tt>.
newRule :: Text -> Rule

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this <tt>Rule</tt>.
--   The name can contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9),
--   with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It can't contain
--   whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF, including "All" and
--   "Default_Action." You can't change <tt>MetricName</tt> after you
--   create the <tt>Rule</tt>.
rule_metricName :: Lens' Rule (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name or description for the <tt>Rule</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>Rule</tt> after you create it.
rule_name :: Lens' Rule (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to
--   get more information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
rule_ruleId :: Lens' Rule Text

-- | The <tt>Predicates</tt> object contains one <tt>Predicate</tt> element
--   for each ByteMatchSet, IPSet, or SqlInjectionMatchSet object that you
--   want to include in a <tt>Rule</tt>.
rule_predicates :: Lens' Rule [Predicate]

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   A collection of predefined rules that you can add to a web ACL.
--   
--   Rule groups are subject to the following limits:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Three rule groups per account. You can request an increase to this
--   limit by contacting customer support.</li>
--   <li>One rule group per web ACL.</li>
--   <li>Ten rules per rule group.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRuleGroup</a> smart constructor.
data RuleGroup
RuleGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> RuleGroup

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change the name of the
--   metric after you create the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
[$sel:metricName:RuleGroup'] :: RuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name or description for the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:RuleGroup'] :: RuleGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You use
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> to get more information about a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> (see GetRuleGroup), update a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   (see UpdateRuleGroup), insert a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRuleGroup).
--   
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> is returned by CreateRuleGroup and by
--   ListRuleGroups.
[$sel:ruleGroupId:RuleGroup'] :: RuleGroup -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RuleGroup</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:RuleGroup'</a>, <a>ruleGroup_metricName</a> - A
--   friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change the name of the
--   metric after you create the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RuleGroup'</a>, <a>ruleGroup_name</a> - The friendly name
--   or description for the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You can't change the name
--   of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleGroupId:RuleGroup'</a>, <a>ruleGroup_ruleGroupId</a> - A
--   unique identifier for a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You use
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> to get more information about a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> (see GetRuleGroup), update a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   (see UpdateRuleGroup), insert a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRuleGroup).
--   
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> is returned by CreateRuleGroup and by
--   ListRuleGroups.
newRuleGroup :: Text -> RuleGroup

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change the name of the
--   metric after you create the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
ruleGroup_metricName :: Lens' RuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name or description for the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
ruleGroup_name :: Lens' RuleGroup (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You use
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> to get more information about a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> (see GetRuleGroup), update a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   (see UpdateRuleGroup), insert a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete a one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRuleGroup).
--   
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> is returned by CreateRuleGroup and by
--   ListRuleGroups.
ruleGroup_ruleGroupId :: Lens' RuleGroup Text

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Contains the identifier and the friendly name or description of the
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRuleGroupSummary</a> smart constructor.
data RuleGroupSummary
RuleGroupSummary' :: Text -> Text -> RuleGroupSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You use
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> to get more information about a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> (see GetRuleGroup), update a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   (see UpdateRuleGroup), insert a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRuleGroup).
--

--   ListRuleGroups.

-- | A friendly name or description of the RuleGroup. You can't change the
--   name of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:RuleGroupSummary'] :: RuleGroupSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RuleGroupSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleGroupId:RuleGroupSummary'</a>,
--   <a>ruleGroupSummary_ruleGroupId</a> - A unique identifier for a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You use <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> to get more
--   information about a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> (see GetRuleGroup), update a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> (see UpdateRuleGroup), insert a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   into a <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRuleGroup).
--   
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> is returned by CreateRuleGroup and by
--   ListRuleGroups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RuleGroupSummary'</a>, <a>ruleGroupSummary_name</a> - A
--   friendly name or description of the RuleGroup. You can't change the
--   name of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
newRuleGroupSummary :: Text -> Text -> RuleGroupSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You use
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> to get more information about a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> (see GetRuleGroup), update a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>
--   (see UpdateRuleGroup), insert a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRuleGroup).
--   
--   <tt>RuleGroupId</tt> is returned by CreateRuleGroup and by
--   ListRuleGroups.
ruleGroupSummary_ruleGroupId :: Lens' RuleGroupSummary Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the RuleGroup. You can't change the
--   name of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
ruleGroupSummary_name :: Lens' RuleGroupSummary Text

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> and indicates whether you want to
--   add it to a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> or delete it from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRuleGroupUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data RuleGroupUpdate
RuleGroupUpdate' :: ChangeAction -> ActivatedRule -> RuleGroupUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> to a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an
--   <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
[$sel:action:RuleGroupUpdate'] :: RuleGroupUpdate -> ChangeAction

-- | The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object specifies a <tt>Rule</tt> that you
--   want to insert or delete, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt> in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS WAF to take when a
--   web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt> (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>,
--   or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
[$sel:activatedRule:RuleGroupUpdate'] :: RuleGroupUpdate -> ActivatedRule

-- | Create a value of <a>RuleGroupUpdate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:RuleGroupUpdate'</a>, <a>ruleGroupUpdate_action</a> -
--   Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> to a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an
--   <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activatedRule:RuleGroupUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>ruleGroupUpdate_activatedRule</a> - The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt>
--   object specifies a <tt>Rule</tt> that you want to insert or delete,
--   the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt> in the <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the
--   action that you want AWS WAF to take when a web request matches the
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
newRuleGroupUpdate :: ChangeAction -> ActivatedRule -> RuleGroupUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add an <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> to a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove an
--   <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> from a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
ruleGroupUpdate_action :: Lens' RuleGroupUpdate ChangeAction

-- | The <tt>ActivatedRule</tt> object specifies a <tt>Rule</tt> that you
--   want to insert or delete, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt> in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, and the action that you want AWS WAF to take when a
--   web request matches the <tt>Rule</tt> (<tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>,
--   or <tt>COUNT</tt>).
ruleGroupUpdate_activatedRule :: Lens' RuleGroupUpdate ActivatedRule

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Contains the identifier and the friendly name or description of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRuleSummary</a> smart constructor.
data RuleSummary
RuleSummary' :: Text -> Text -> RuleSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to
--   get more information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
[$sel:ruleId:RuleSummary'] :: RuleSummary -> Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the Rule. You can't change the name
--   of a <tt>Rule</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:RuleSummary'] :: RuleSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RuleSummary</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleId:RuleSummary'</a>, <a>ruleSummary_ruleId</a> - A unique
--   identifier for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to get more
--   information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RuleSummary'</a>, <a>ruleSummary_name</a> - A friendly
--   name or description of the Rule. You can't change the name of a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> after you create it.
newRuleSummary :: Text -> Text -> RuleSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>Rule</tt>. You use <tt>RuleId</tt> to
--   get more information about a <tt>Rule</tt> (see GetRule), update a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), insert a <tt>Rule</tt> into a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> or delete one from a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see
--   UpdateWebACL), or delete a <tt>Rule</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteRule).
--   
--   <tt>RuleId</tt> is returned by CreateRule and by ListRules.
ruleSummary_ruleId :: Lens' RuleSummary Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the Rule. You can't change the name
--   of a <tt>Rule</tt> after you create it.
ruleSummary_name :: Lens' RuleSummary Text

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies a <tt>Predicate</tt> (such as an <tt>IPSet</tt>) and
--   indicates whether you want to add it to a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete it
--   from a <tt>Rule</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRuleUpdate</a> smart constructor.
data RuleUpdate
RuleUpdate' :: ChangeAction -> Predicate -> RuleUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add a <tt>Predicate</tt> to a
--   <tt>Rule</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove a <tt>Predicate</tt> from
--   a <tt>Rule</tt>.
[$sel:action:RuleUpdate'] :: RuleUpdate -> ChangeAction

-- | The ID of the <tt>Predicate</tt> (such as an <tt>IPSet</tt>) that you
--   want to add to a <tt>Rule</tt>.
[$sel:predicate:RuleUpdate'] :: RuleUpdate -> Predicate

-- | Create a value of <a>RuleUpdate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:RuleUpdate'</a>, <a>ruleUpdate_action</a> - Specify
--   <tt>INSERT</tt> to add a <tt>Predicate</tt> to a <tt>Rule</tt>. Use
--   <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove a <tt>Predicate</tt> from a <tt>Rule</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:predicate:RuleUpdate'</a>, <a>ruleUpdate_predicate</a> - The
--   ID of the <tt>Predicate</tt> (such as an <tt>IPSet</tt>) that you want
--   to add to a <tt>Rule</tt>.
newRuleUpdate :: ChangeAction -> Predicate -> RuleUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add a <tt>Predicate</tt> to a
--   <tt>Rule</tt>. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove a <tt>Predicate</tt> from
--   a <tt>Rule</tt>.
ruleUpdate_action :: Lens' RuleUpdate ChangeAction

-- | The ID of the <tt>Predicate</tt> (such as an <tt>IPSet</tt>) that you
--   want to add to a <tt>Rule</tt>.
ruleUpdate_predicate :: Lens' RuleUpdate Predicate

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   The response from a GetSampledRequests request includes a
--   <tt>SampledHTTPRequests</tt> complex type that appears as
--   <tt>SampledRequests</tt> in the response syntax.
--   <tt>SampledHTTPRequests</tt> contains one <tt>SampledHTTPRequest</tt>
--   object for each web request that is returned by
--   <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSampledHTTPRequest</a> smart constructor.
data SampledHTTPRequest
SampledHTTPRequest' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> HTTPRequest -> Natural -> SampledHTTPRequest

-- | This value is returned if the <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> request
--   specifies the ID of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> rather than the ID of an
--   individual rule. <tt>RuleWithinRuleGroup</tt> is the rule within the
--   specified <tt>RuleGroup</tt> that matched the request listed in the
--   response.
[$sel:ruleWithinRuleGroup:SampledHTTPRequest'] :: SampledHTTPRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The action for the <tt>Rule</tt> that the request matched:
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>.
[$sel:action:SampledHTTPRequest'] :: SampledHTTPRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | The time at which AWS WAF received the request from your AWS resource,
--   in Unix time format (in seconds).
[$sel:timestamp:SampledHTTPRequest'] :: SampledHTTPRequest -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A complex type that contains detailed information about the request.
[$sel:request:SampledHTTPRequest'] :: SampledHTTPRequest -> HTTPRequest

-- | A value that indicates how one result in the response relates
--   proportionally to other results in the response. A result that has a
--   weight of <tt>2</tt> represents roughly twice as many CloudFront web
--   requests as a result that has a weight of <tt>1</tt>.
[$sel:weight:SampledHTTPRequest'] :: SampledHTTPRequest -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>SampledHTTPRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleWithinRuleGroup:SampledHTTPRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sampledHTTPRequest_ruleWithinRuleGroup</a> - This value is returned
--   if the <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> request specifies the ID of a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> rather than the ID of an individual rule.
--   <tt>RuleWithinRuleGroup</tt> is the rule within the specified
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> that matched the request listed in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:SampledHTTPRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sampledHTTPRequest_action</a> - The action for the <tt>Rule</tt>
--   that the request matched: <tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or
--   <tt>COUNT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:SampledHTTPRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sampledHTTPRequest_timestamp</a> - The time at which AWS WAF
--   received the request from your AWS resource, in Unix time format (in
--   seconds).
--   
--   <a>$sel:request:SampledHTTPRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sampledHTTPRequest_request</a> - A complex type that contains
--   detailed information about the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:weight:SampledHTTPRequest'</a>,
--   <a>sampledHTTPRequest_weight</a> - A value that indicates how one
--   result in the response relates proportionally to other results in the
--   response. A result that has a weight of <tt>2</tt> represents roughly
--   twice as many CloudFront web requests as a result that has a weight of
--   <tt>1</tt>.
newSampledHTTPRequest :: HTTPRequest -> Natural -> SampledHTTPRequest

-- | This value is returned if the <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> request
--   specifies the ID of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> rather than the ID of an
--   individual rule. <tt>RuleWithinRuleGroup</tt> is the rule within the
--   specified <tt>RuleGroup</tt> that matched the request listed in the
--   response.
sampledHTTPRequest_ruleWithinRuleGroup :: Lens' SampledHTTPRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The action for the <tt>Rule</tt> that the request matched:
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, <tt>BLOCK</tt>, or <tt>COUNT</tt>.
sampledHTTPRequest_action :: Lens' SampledHTTPRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The time at which AWS WAF received the request from your AWS resource,
--   in Unix time format (in seconds).
sampledHTTPRequest_timestamp :: Lens' SampledHTTPRequest (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A complex type that contains detailed information about the request.
sampledHTTPRequest_request :: Lens' SampledHTTPRequest HTTPRequest

-- | A value that indicates how one result in the response relates
--   proportionally to other results in the response. A result that has a
--   weight of <tt>2</tt> represents roughly twice as many CloudFront web
--   requests as a result that has a weight of <tt>1</tt>.
sampledHTTPRequest_weight :: Lens' SampledHTTPRequest Natural

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies a constraint on the size of a part of the web request. AWS
--   WAF uses the <tt>Size</tt>, <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt>, and
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an expression in the form of
--   "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> size in bytes of
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true, the
--   <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSizeConstraint</a> smart constructor.
data SizeConstraint
SizeConstraint' :: FieldToMatch -> TextTransformation -> ComparisonOperator -> Natural -> SizeConstraint

-- | Specifies where in a web request to look for the size constraint.
[$sel:fieldToMatch:SizeConstraint'] :: SizeConstraint -> FieldToMatch

-- | Text transformations eliminate some of the unusual formatting that
--   attackers use in web requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you
--   specify a transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   Note that if you choose <tt>BODY</tt> for the value of <tt>Type</tt>,
--   you must choose <tt>NONE</tt> for <tt>TextTransformation</tt> because
--   CloudFront forwards only the first 8192 bytes for inspection.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.
--   
--   <b>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace HTML-encoded characters with unencoded
--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>LOWERCASE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
[$sel:textTransformation:SizeConstraint'] :: SizeConstraint -> TextTransformation

-- | The type of comparison you want AWS WAF to perform. AWS WAF uses this
--   in combination with the provided <tt>Size</tt> and
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an expression in the form of
--   "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> size in bytes of
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true, the
--   <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.
--   
--   <b>EQ</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is equal to the size of
--   the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>NE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is not equal to the size
--   of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>LE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is less than or equal to
--   the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>LT</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is strictly less than the
--   size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>GE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is greater than or equal
--   to the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>GT</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is strictly greater than
--   the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
[$sel:comparisonOperator:SizeConstraint'] :: SizeConstraint -> ComparisonOperator

-- | The size in bytes that you want AWS WAF to compare against the size of
--   the specified <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>. AWS WAF uses this in combination
--   with <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> and <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an
--   expression in the form of "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt>
--   size in bytes of <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true,
--   the <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.
--   
--   Valid values for size are 0 - 21474836480 bytes (0 - 20 GB).
--   
--   If you specify <tt>URI</tt> for the value of <tt>Type</tt>, the / in
--   the URI counts as one character. For example, the URI
--   <tt>/logo.jpg</tt> is nine characters long.
[$sel:size:SizeConstraint'] :: SizeConstraint -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>SizeConstraint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldToMatch:SizeConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>sizeConstraint_fieldToMatch</a> - Specifies where in a web request
--   to look for the size constraint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textTransformation:SizeConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>sizeConstraint_textTransformation</a> - Text transformations
--   eliminate some of the unusual formatting that attackers use in web
--   requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you specify a
--   transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   Note that if you choose <tt>BODY</tt> for the value of <tt>Type</tt>,
--   you must choose <tt>NONE</tt> for <tt>TextTransformation</tt> because
--   CloudFront forwards only the first 8192 bytes for inspection.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.
--   
--   <b>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace HTML-encoded characters with unencoded
--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>LOWERCASE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:SizeConstraint'</a>,
--   <a>sizeConstraint_comparisonOperator</a> - The type of comparison you
--   want AWS WAF to perform. AWS WAF uses this in combination with the
--   provided <tt>Size</tt> and <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an
--   expression in the form of "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt>
--   size in bytes of <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true,
--   the <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.
--   
--   <b>EQ</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is equal to the size of
--   the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>NE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is not equal to the size
--   of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>LE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is less than or equal to
--   the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>LT</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is strictly less than the
--   size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>GE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is greater than or equal
--   to the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>GT</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is strictly greater than
--   the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:SizeConstraint'</a>, <a>sizeConstraint_size</a> - The
--   size in bytes that you want AWS WAF to compare against the size of the
--   specified <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>. AWS WAF uses this in combination with
--   <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> and <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an
--   expression in the form of "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt>
--   size in bytes of <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true,
--   the <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.
--   
--   Valid values for size are 0 - 21474836480 bytes (0 - 20 GB).
--   
--   If you specify <tt>URI</tt> for the value of <tt>Type</tt>, the / in
--   the URI counts as one character. For example, the URI
--   <tt>/logo.jpg</tt> is nine characters long.
newSizeConstraint :: FieldToMatch -> TextTransformation -> ComparisonOperator -> Natural -> SizeConstraint

-- | Specifies where in a web request to look for the size constraint.
sizeConstraint_fieldToMatch :: Lens' SizeConstraint FieldToMatch

-- | Text transformations eliminate some of the unusual formatting that
--   attackers use in web requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you
--   specify a transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   Note that if you choose <tt>BODY</tt> for the value of <tt>Type</tt>,
--   you must choose <tt>NONE</tt> for <tt>TextTransformation</tt> because
--   CloudFront forwards only the first 8192 bytes for inspection.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.
--   
--   <b>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace HTML-encoded characters with unencoded
--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>LOWERCASE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
sizeConstraint_textTransformation :: Lens' SizeConstraint TextTransformation

-- | The type of comparison you want AWS WAF to perform. AWS WAF uses this
--   in combination with the provided <tt>Size</tt> and
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an expression in the form of
--   "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> size in bytes of
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true, the
--   <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.
--   
--   <b>EQ</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is equal to the size of
--   the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>NE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is not equal to the size
--   of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>LE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is less than or equal to
--   the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>LT</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is strictly less than the
--   size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>GE</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is greater than or equal
--   to the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   
--   <b>GT</b>: Used to test if the <tt>Size</tt> is strictly greater than
--   the size of the <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
sizeConstraint_comparisonOperator :: Lens' SizeConstraint ComparisonOperator

-- | The size in bytes that you want AWS WAF to compare against the size of
--   the specified <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>. AWS WAF uses this in combination
--   with <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> and <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an
--   expression in the form of "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt>
--   size in bytes of <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true,
--   the <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.
--   
--   Valid values for size are 0 - 21474836480 bytes (0 - 20 GB).
--   
--   If you specify <tt>URI</tt> for the value of <tt>Type</tt>, the / in
--   the URI counts as one character. For example, the URI
--   <tt>/logo.jpg</tt> is nine characters long.
sizeConstraint_size :: Lens' SizeConstraint Natural

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   A complex type that contains <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> objects, which
--   specify the parts of web requests that you want AWS WAF to inspect the
--   size of. If a <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt> contains more than one
--   <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> object, a request only needs to match one
--   constraint to be considered a match.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSizeConstraintSet</a> smart constructor.
data SizeConstraintSet
SizeConstraintSet' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> [SizeConstraint] -> SizeConstraintSet

-- | The name, if any, of the <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt>.
[$sel:name:SizeConstraintSet'] :: SizeConstraintSet -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSetId</tt> to get information about a
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt> (see GetSizeConstraintSet), update a
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt> (see UpdateSizeConstraintSet), insert a
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt> into a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one from a
--   <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and delete a
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt> from AWS WAF (see DeleteSizeConstraintSet).
--   
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSetId</tt> is returned by CreateSizeConstraintSet
--   and by ListSizeConstraintSets.
[$sel:sizeConstraintSetId:SizeConstraintSet'] :: SizeConstraintSet -> Text

-- | Specifies the parts of web requests that you want to inspect the size
--   of.
[$sel:sizeConstraints:SizeConstraintSet'] :: SizeConstraintSet -> [SizeConstraint]

--   omitted.

--   GetSizeConstraintSet), update a <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt> (see

sizeConstraintSet_sizeConstraints :: Lens' SizeConstraintSet [SizeConstraint]

--   Specifies the part of a web request that you want to inspect the size
--   of and indicates whether you want to add the specification to a
--   SizeConstraintSet or delete it from a <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt>.

data SizeConstraintSetUpdate

--   SizeConstraintSet. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove a
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSetUpdate</tt> from a <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt>.
[$sel:action:SizeConstraintSetUpdate'] :: SizeConstraintSetUpdate -> ChangeAction

-- | Specifies a constraint on the size of a part of the web request. AWS
--   WAF uses the <tt>Size</tt>, <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt>, and
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> to build an expression in the form of
--   "<tt>Size</tt> <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> size in bytes of
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>". If that expression is true, the
--   <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered to match.

--   a SizeConstraintSetUpdate to a SizeConstraintSet. Use <tt>DELETE</tt>
--   to remove a <tt>SizeConstraintSetUpdate</tt> from a
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeConstraint:SizeConstraintSetUpdate'</a>,
--   <a>sizeConstraintSetUpdate_sizeConstraint</a> - Specifies a constraint
--   on the size of a part of the web request. AWS WAF uses the
--   <tt>Size</tt>, <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt>, and <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>
--   to build an expression in the form of "<tt>Size</tt>
--   <tt>ComparisonOperator</tt> size in bytes of <tt>FieldToMatch</tt>".
--   If that expression is true, the <tt>SizeConstraint</tt> is considered
--   to match.
newSizeConstraintSetUpdate :: ChangeAction -> SizeConstraint -> SizeConstraintSetUpdate

-- | Specify <tt>INSERT</tt> to add a SizeConstraintSetUpdate to a
--   SizeConstraintSet. Use <tt>DELETE</tt> to remove a
--   <tt>SizeConstraintSetUpdate</tt> from a <tt>SizeConstraintSet</tt>.

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   A complex type that contains <tt>SqlInjectionMatchTuple</tt> objects,
--   which specify the parts of web requests that you want AWS WAF to
--   inspect for snippets of malicious SQL code and, if you want AWS WAF to
--   inspect a header, the name of the header. If a
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> contains more than one
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchTuple</tt> object, a request needs to include
--   snippets of SQL code in only one of the specified parts of the request
--   to be considered a match.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSqlInjectionMatchSet</a> smart constructor.
data SqlInjectionMatchSet
SqlInjectionMatchSet' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> [SqlInjectionMatchTuple] -> SqlInjectionMatchSet

-- | The name, if any, of the <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt>.
[$sel:name:SqlInjectionMatchSet'] :: SqlInjectionMatchSet -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSetId</tt> to get information about a
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> (see GetSqlInjectionMatchSet), update a
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> (see UpdateSqlInjectionMatchSet), insert
--   a <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> into a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one
--   from a <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and delete a
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteSqlInjectionMatchSet).
--   
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSetId</tt> is returned by
--   CreateSqlInjectionMatchSet and by ListSqlInjectionMatchSets.
[$sel:sqlInjectionMatchSetId:SqlInjectionMatchSet'] :: SqlInjectionMatchSet -> Text

-- | Specifies the parts of web requests that you want to inspect for
--   snippets of malicious SQL code.
[$sel:sqlInjectionMatchTuples:SqlInjectionMatchSet'] :: SqlInjectionMatchSet -> [SqlInjectionMatchTuple]

-- | Create a value of <a>SqlInjectionMatchSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SqlInjectionMatchSet'</a>,
--   <a>sqlInjectionMatchSet_name</a> - The name, if any, of the
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sqlInjectionMatchSetId:SqlInjectionMatchSet'</a>,
--   <a>sqlInjectionMatchSet_sqlInjectionMatchSetId</a> - A unique
--   identifier for a <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSetId</tt> to get information about a
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> (see GetSqlInjectionMatchSet), update a
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> (see UpdateSqlInjectionMatchSet), insert
--   a <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> into a <tt>Rule</tt> or delete one
--   from a <tt>Rule</tt> (see UpdateRule), and delete a
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt> from AWS WAF (see
--   DeleteSqlInjectionMatchSet).
--   
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSetId</tt> is returned by
--   CreateSqlInjectionMatchSet and by ListSqlInjectionMatchSets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sqlInjectionMatchTuples:SqlInjectionMatchSet'</a>,
--   <a>sqlInjectionMatchSet_sqlInjectionMatchTuples</a> - Specifies the
--   parts of web requests that you want to inspect for snippets of
--   malicious SQL code.
newSqlInjectionMatchSet :: Text -> SqlInjectionMatchSet

-- | The name, if any, of the <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt>.
sqlInjectionMatchSet_name :: Lens' SqlInjectionMatchSet (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSet</tt>. You use
--   <tt>SqlInjectionMatchSetId</tt> to get information about a

sqlInjectionMatchSetUpdate_sqlInjectionMatchTuple :: Lens' SqlInjectionMatchSetUpdate SqlInjectionMatchTuple

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Specifies the part of a web request that you want AWS WAF to inspect
--   for snippets of malicious SQL code and, if you want AWS WAF to inspect
--   a header, the name of the header.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSqlInjectionMatchTuple</a> smart constructor.
data SqlInjectionMatchTuple
SqlInjectionMatchTuple' :: FieldToMatch -> TextTransformation -> SqlInjectionMatchTuple

-- | Specifies where in a web request to look for snippets of malicious SQL
--   code.
[$sel:fieldToMatch:SqlInjectionMatchTuple'] :: SqlInjectionMatchTuple -> FieldToMatch

-- | Text transformations eliminate some of the unusual formatting that
--   attackers use in web requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you
--   specify a transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.
--   
--   <b>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace HTML-encoded characters with unencoded
--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>LOWERCASE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
[$sel:textTransformation:SqlInjectionMatchTuple'] :: SqlInjectionMatchTuple -> TextTransformation

-- | Create a value of <a>SqlInjectionMatchTuple</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldToMatch:SqlInjectionMatchTuple'</a>,
--   <a>sqlInjectionMatchTuple_fieldToMatch</a> - Specifies where in a web
--   request to look for snippets of malicious SQL code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:textTransformation:SqlInjectionMatchTuple'</a>,
--   <a>sqlInjectionMatchTuple_textTransformation</a> - Text
--   transformations eliminate some of the unusual formatting that
--   attackers use in web requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you
--   specify a transformation, AWS WAF performs the transformation on
--   <tt>FieldToMatch</tt> before inspecting it for a match.
--   
--   You can only specify a single type of TextTransformation.
--   
--   <b>CMD_LINE</b>
--   
--   When you're concerned that attackers are injecting an operating system
--   command line command and using unusual formatting to disguise some or
--   all of the command, use this option to perform the following
--   transformations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Delete the following characters: \ " ' ^</li>
--   <li>Delete spaces before the following characters: / (</li>
--   <li>Replace the following characters with a space: , ;</li>
--   <li>Replace multiple spaces with one space</li>
--   <li>Convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to replace the following characters with a space
--   character (decimal 32):
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>\f, formfeed, decimal 12</li>
--   <li>\t, tab, decimal 9</li>
--   <li>\n, newline, decimal 10</li>
--   <li>\r, carriage return, decimal 13</li>
--   <li>\v, vertical tab, decimal 11</li>
--   <li>non-breaking space, decimal 160</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>COMPRESS_WHITE_SPACE</tt> also replaces multiple spaces with one
--   space.

--   characters. <tt>HTML_ENTITY_DECODE</tt> performs the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)quot;</tt> with <tt>"</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)nbsp;</tt> with a non-breaking space,
--   decimal 160</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)lt;</tt> with a "less than" symbol</li>
--   <li>Replaces <tt>(ampersand)gt;</tt> with <tt>&gt;</tt></li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in hexadecimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#xhhhh;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   <li>Replaces characters that are represented in decimal format,
--   <tt>(ampersand)#nnnn;</tt>, with the corresponding characters</li>
--   </ul>

--   
--   Use this option to convert uppercase letters (A-Z) to lowercase (a-z).
--   
--   <b>URL_DECODE</b>
--   
--   Use this option to decode a URL-encoded value.
--   
--   <b>NONE</b>
--   
--   Specify <tt>NONE</tt> if you don't want to perform any text
--   transformations.
newSqlInjectionMatchTuple :: FieldToMatch -> TextTransformation -> SqlInjectionMatchTuple

-- | Specifies where in a web request to look for snippets of malicious SQL
--   code.
sqlInjectionMatchTuple_fieldToMatch :: Lens' SqlInjectionMatchTuple FieldToMatch

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.

--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   A summary of the rule groups you are subscribed to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscribedRuleGroupSummary</a> smart constructor.
data SubscribedRuleGroupSummary
SubscribedRuleGroupSummary' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> SubscribedRuleGroupSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
[$sel:ruleGroupId:SubscribedRuleGroupSummary'] :: SubscribedRuleGroupSummary -> Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:SubscribedRuleGroupSummary'] :: SubscribedRuleGroupSummary -> Text

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change the name of the
--   metric after you create the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
[$sel:metricName:SubscribedRuleGroupSummary'] :: SubscribedRuleGroupSummary -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SubscribedRuleGroupSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   for a <tt>RuleGroup</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SubscribedRuleGroupSummary'</a>,
--   <a>subscribedRuleGroupSummary_name</a> - A friendly name or
--   description of the <tt>RuleGroup</tt>. You can't change the name of a
--   <tt>RuleGroup</tt> after you create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:SubscribedRuleGroupSummary'</a>,

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   A tag associated with an AWS resource. Tags are key:value pairs that
--   you can use to categorize and manage your resources, for purposes like
--   billing. For example, you might set the tag key to "customer" and the
--   value to the customer name or ID. You can specify one or more tags to
--   add to each AWS resource, up to 50 tags for a resource.
--   
--   Tagging is only available through the API, SDKs, and CLI. You can't
--   manage or view tags through the AWS WAF Classic console. You can tag
--   the AWS resources that you manage through AWS WAF Classic: web ACLs,
--   rule groups, and rules.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> -
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Information for a tag associated with an AWS resource. Tags are
--   key:value pairs that you can use to categorize and manage your
--   resources, for purposes like billing. For example, you might set the
--   tag key to "customer" and the value to the customer name or ID. You
--   can specify one or more tags to add to each AWS resource, up to 50
--   tags for a resource.
--   
--   Tagging is only available through the API, SDKs, and CLI. You can't
--   manage or view tags through the AWS WAF Classic console. You can tag
--   the AWS resources that you manage through AWS WAF Classic: web ACLs,
--   rule groups, and rules.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagInfoForResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagInfoForResource
TagInfoForResource' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Text -> TagInfoForResource
[$sel:tagList:TagInfoForResource'] :: TagInfoForResource -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)
[$sel:resourceARN:TagInfoForResource'] :: TagInfoForResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagInfoForResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>tagInfoForResource_resourceARN</a> -
newTagInfoForResource :: TagInfoForResource

tagInfoForResource_tagList :: Lens' TagInfoForResource (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

tagInfoForResource_resourceARN :: Lens' TagInfoForResource (Maybe Text)

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   In a GetSampledRequests request, the <tt>StartTime</tt> and
--   <tt>EndTime</tt> objects specify the time range for which you want AWS
--   WAF to return a sample of web requests.
--   
--   You must specify the times in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format.
--   UTC format includes the special designator, <tt>Z</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"2016-09-27T14:50Z"</tt>.
--   
--   In a GetSampledRequests response, the <tt>StartTime</tt> and
--   <tt>EndTime</tt> objects specify the time range for which AWS WAF
--   actually returned a sample of web requests. AWS WAF gets the specified
--   number of requests from among the first 5,000 requests that your AWS
--   resource receives during the specified time period. If your resource
--   receives more than 5,000 requests during that period, AWS WAF stops
--   sampling after the 5,000th request. In that case, <tt>EndTime</tt> is
--   the time that AWS WAF received the 5,000th request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeWindow</a> smart constructor.
data TimeWindow
TimeWindow' :: POSIX -> POSIX -> TimeWindow

-- | The beginning of the time range from which you want
--   <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> to return a sample of the requests that
--   your AWS resource received. You must specify the date and time in
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format. UTC format includes the
--   special designator, <tt>Z</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"2016-09-27T14:50Z"</tt>. You can specify any time range in the
--   previous three hours.
[$sel:startTime:TimeWindow'] :: TimeWindow -> POSIX

-- | The end of the time range from which you want
--   <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> to return a sample of the requests that
--   your AWS resource received. You must specify the date and time in
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format. UTC format includes the
--   special designator, <tt>Z</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"2016-09-27T14:50Z"</tt>. You can specify any time range in the
--   previous three hours.
[$sel:endTime:TimeWindow'] :: TimeWindow -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeWindow</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:TimeWindow'</a>, <a>timeWindow_startTime</a> - The
--   beginning of the time range from which you want
--   <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> to return a sample of the requests that
--   your AWS resource received. You must specify the date and time in
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format. UTC format includes the
--   special designator, <tt>Z</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"2016-09-27T14:50Z"</tt>. You can specify any time range in the
--   previous three hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:TimeWindow'</a>, <a>timeWindow_endTime</a> - The end
--   of the time range from which you want <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> to
--   return a sample of the requests that your AWS resource received. You
--   must specify the date and time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   format. UTC format includes the special designator, <tt>Z</tt>. For
--   example, <tt>"2016-09-27T14:50Z"</tt>. You can specify any time range
--   in the previous three hours.
newTimeWindow :: UTCTime -> UTCTime -> TimeWindow

-- | The beginning of the time range from which you want
--   <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> to return a sample of the requests that
--   your AWS resource received. You must specify the date and time in
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format. UTC format includes the
--   special designator, <tt>Z</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"2016-09-27T14:50Z"</tt>. You can specify any time range in the
--   previous three hours.
timeWindow_startTime :: Lens' TimeWindow UTCTime

-- | The end of the time range from which you want
--   <tt>GetSampledRequests</tt> to return a sample of the requests that
--   your AWS resource received. You must specify the date and time in
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format. UTC format includes the
--   special designator, <tt>Z</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>"2016-09-27T14:50Z"</tt>. You can specify any time range in the
--   previous three hours.
timeWindow_endTime :: Lens' TimeWindow UTCTime

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   For the action that is associated with a rule in a <tt>WebACL</tt>,
--   specifies the action that you want AWS WAF to perform when a web
--   request matches all of the conditions in a rule. For the default
--   action in a <tt>WebACL</tt>, specifies the action that you want AWS
--   WAF to take when a web request doesn't match all of the conditions in
--   any of the rules in a <tt>WebACL</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWafAction</a> smart constructor.
data WafAction
WafAction' :: WafActionType -> WafAction

-- | Specifies how you want AWS WAF to respond to requests that match the
--   settings in a <tt>Rule</tt>. Valid settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW</tt>: AWS WAF allows requests</li>
--   <li><tt>BLOCK</tt>: AWS WAF blocks requests</li>
--   <li><tt>COUNT</tt>: AWS WAF increments a counter of the requests that
--   match all of the conditions in the rule. AWS WAF then continues to
--   inspect the web request based on the remaining rules in the web ACL.
--   You can't specify <tt>COUNT</tt> for the default action for a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':WafAction'] :: WafAction -> WafActionType

-- | Create a value of <a>WafAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':WafAction'</a>, <a>wafAction_type</a> - Specifies how
--   you want AWS WAF to respond to requests that match the settings in a
--   <tt>Rule</tt>. Valid settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW</tt>: AWS WAF allows requests</li>
--   <li><tt>BLOCK</tt>: AWS WAF blocks requests</li>
--   <li><tt>COUNT</tt>: AWS WAF increments a counter of the requests that
--   match all of the conditions in the rule. AWS WAF then continues to
--   inspect the web request based on the remaining rules in the web ACL.
--   You can't specify <tt>COUNT</tt> for the default action for a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
newWafAction :: WafActionType -> WafAction

-- | Specifies how you want AWS WAF to respond to requests that match the
--   settings in a <tt>Rule</tt>. Valid settings include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALLOW</tt>: AWS WAF allows requests</li>
--   <li><tt>BLOCK</tt>: AWS WAF blocks requests</li>
--   <li><tt>COUNT</tt>: AWS WAF increments a counter of the requests that
--   match all of the conditions in the rule. AWS WAF then continues to
--   inspect the web request based on the remaining rules in the web ACL.
--   You can't specify <tt>COUNT</tt> for the default action for a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
wafAction_type :: Lens' WafAction WafActionType

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   The action to take if any rule within the <tt>RuleGroup</tt> matches a
--   request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWafOverrideAction</a> smart constructor.
data WafOverrideAction
WafOverrideAction' :: WafOverrideActionType -> WafOverrideAction

-- | <tt>COUNT</tt> overrides the action specified by the individual rule
--   within a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> . If set to <tt>NONE</tt>, the rule's
--   action will take place.
[$sel:type':WafOverrideAction'] :: WafOverrideAction -> WafOverrideActionType

-- | Create a value of <a>WafOverrideAction</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':WafOverrideAction'</a>, <a>wafOverrideAction_type</a> -
--   <tt>COUNT</tt> overrides the action specified by the individual rule
--   within a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> . If set to <tt>NONE</tt>, the rule's
--   action will take place.
newWafOverrideAction :: WafOverrideActionType -> WafOverrideAction

-- | <tt>COUNT</tt> overrides the action specified by the individual rule
--   within a <tt>RuleGroup</tt> . If set to <tt>NONE</tt>, the rule's
--   action will take place.
wafOverrideAction_type :: Lens' WafOverrideAction WafOverrideActionType

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Contains the <tt>Rules</tt> that identify the requests that you want
--   to allow, block, or count. In a <tt>WebACL</tt>, you also specify a
--   default action (<tt>ALLOW</tt> or <tt>BLOCK</tt>), and the action for
--   each <tt>Rule</tt> that you add to a <tt>WebACL</tt>, for example,
--   block requests from specified IP addresses or block requests from
--   specified referrers. You also associate the <tt>WebACL</tt> with a
--   CloudFront distribution to identify the requests that you want AWS WAF
--   to filter. If you add more than one <tt>Rule</tt> to a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, a request needs to match only one of the
--   specifications to be allowed, blocked, or counted. For more
--   information, see UpdateWebACL.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebACL</a> smart constructor.
data WebACL
WebACL' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> WafAction -> [ActivatedRule] -> WebACL

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change
--   <tt>MetricName</tt> after you create the <tt>WebACL</tt>.
[$sel:metricName:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Maybe Text

-- | A friendly name or description of the <tt>WebACL</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
[$sel:name:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Maybe Text

-- | Tha Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the web ACL.
[$sel:webACLArn:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
[$sel:webACLId:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> Text

-- | The action to perform if none of the <tt>Rules</tt> contained in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> match. The action is specified by the WafAction
--   object.
[$sel:defaultAction:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> WafAction

-- | An array that contains the action for each <tt>Rule</tt> in a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt>, and the ID of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt>.
[$sel:rules:WebACL'] :: WebACL -> [ActivatedRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>WebACL</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_metricName</a> - A friendly
--   name or description for the metrics for this <tt>WebACL</tt>. The name
--   can contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum
--   length 128 and minimum length one. It can't contain whitespace or
--   metric names reserved for AWS WAF, including "All" and
--   "Default_Action." You can't change <tt>MetricName</tt> after you
--   create the <tt>WebACL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_name</a> - A friendly name or
--   description of the <tt>WebACL</tt>. You can't change the name of a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:webACLArn:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_webACLArn</a> - Tha Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the web ACL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:webACLId:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_webACLId</a> - A unique
--   identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt> to get
--   information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAction:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_defaultAction</a> - The
--   action to perform if none of the <tt>Rules</tt> contained in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> match. The action is specified by the WafAction
--   object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:WebACL'</a>, <a>webACL_rules</a> - An array that
--   contains the action for each <tt>Rule</tt> in a <tt>WebACL</tt>, the
--   priority of the <tt>Rule</tt>, and the ID of the <tt>Rule</tt>.
newWebACL :: Text -> WafAction -> WebACL

-- | A friendly name or description for the metrics for this
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters
--   (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), with maximum length 128 and minimum length one. It
--   can't contain whitespace or metric names reserved for AWS WAF,
--   including "All" and "Default_Action." You can't change
--   <tt>MetricName</tt> after you create the <tt>WebACL</tt>.
webACL_metricName :: Lens' WebACL (Maybe Text)

-- | A friendly name or description of the <tt>WebACL</tt>. You can't
--   change the name of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
webACL_name :: Lens' WebACL (Maybe Text)

-- | Tha Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the web ACL.
webACL_webACLArn :: Lens' WebACL (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
--   AWS WAF (see DeleteWebACL).
--   
--   <tt>WebACLId</tt> is returned by CreateWebACL and by ListWebACLs.
webACL_webACLId :: Lens' WebACL Text

-- | The action to perform if none of the <tt>Rules</tt> contained in the
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> match. The action is specified by the WafAction
--   object.
webACL_defaultAction :: Lens' WebACL WafAction

-- | An array that contains the action for each <tt>Rule</tt> in a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt>, the priority of the <tt>Rule</tt>, and the ID of the
--   <tt>Rule</tt>.
webACL_rules :: Lens' WebACL [ActivatedRule]

-- | This is <b>AWS WAF Classic</b> documentation. For more information,
--   see <a>AWS WAF Classic</a> in the developer guide.
--   
--   <b>For the latest version of AWS WAF</b>, use the AWS WAFV2 API and
--   see the <a>AWS WAF Developer Guide</a>. With the latest version, AWS
--   WAF has a single set of endpoints for regional and global use.
--   
--   Contains the identifier and the name or description of the WebACL.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebACLSummary</a> smart constructor.
data WebACLSummary
WebACLSummary' :: Text -> Text -> WebACLSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a

--   friendly name or description of the WebACL. You can't change the name
--   of a <tt>WebACL</tt> after you create it.
newWebACLSummary :: Text -> Text -> WebACLSummary

-- | A unique identifier for a <tt>WebACL</tt>. You use <tt>WebACLId</tt>
--   to get information about a <tt>WebACL</tt> (see GetWebACL), update a
--   <tt>WebACL</tt> (see UpdateWebACL), and delete a <tt>WebACL</tt> from
